intro: Chaetogastra cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its hairy stems and foliage give it a distinctive, velvety appearance.
